  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4306].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When customers reply to notifications from a Service Desk request, but the Service Desk in question does not have a mail channel configured, the contents of the email will not get added to the request, nor will the customer be informed that no mail channel is available for processing their reply.

h3. Suggested Solution
If the mail replies can get processed by JIRA to begin with, such as in a configuration where the outbound mail server has also been configured as an inbound JIRA mail server, if a reply is sent to a Service Desk request, but that Service Desk does not have a mail channel configured, the customer should receive an email reply indicating their message has not been processed and redirect them to the portal instead.
fields.summary: Provide an automated message on replies to requests which Service Desk does not have a mail channel configured

Dear Support,

I was wondering if you can share information about the availability to setting up approvals for Jira Service Desk, hosted on a server. While the cloud version already has the functionality to set up approvals. I'm referring to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-service-desk-approvals-815569154.html].

What I would like to know, can you share your expectation when this function will be available?
Do you also know what will be the version of the Service Desk with the functionality for setting up approvals? We are now on JIRA Service Desk 3.1.9.

Thanks in advance,

Best Regards,

Wim van Oorspronk
fields.summary: Setting up approvals for Jira Service Desk Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an issue is created in JSD 3.2.1 using the 'Create Linked Issue' function, it will not show up in the approver's *Approvals* list in the Customer Portal, even though it is in an Awaiting Approval status.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk 3.2.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue as a customer from the Customer Portal.
# Add an Approver to that issue - it will show up on that approver's *Approvals* list in the Customer Portal.
# Create a new issue using 'Create Linked Issue'.
# Verify that that issue is in the 'Awaiting Approval' status, and has the same user added in step 2 as an Approver.

h3. Expected Results

The new issue will show up on that approver's *Approvals* list in the Customer Portal.

h3. Actual Results

No new issues show up on that approver's *Approvals* list in the Customer Portal.
fields.summary: Approvers are copied over implicitly from the original issue when using the 'Create linked issue' functionality

h3. Problem Definition
When public signup is set to off (*Request security* is set to "Only people who have an account can raise a request") JIRA Service Desk agent won't be able to invite new customers (the *Invite customers* button is missing in the *Customers* page). However project Administrators are still able to invite new customers. 

h3. Suggested Solution
When public signup is turned off in for a Service Desk project:
* Allow Service Desk agent to invite new customers via *Customers* page
* Allow both Service Desk agent and administrators to invite new customers during creation of new ticket on behalf of that new customer (see screenshot below, this is currently possible only when public signup is turned on)
 !2016-09-19_new-customer.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow agent to invite Customer when public signup is off

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When using Crowd directory (connected to an AD in AWS) in User management, during signup process, if the new customer has entered a password that does not meet de password policy defined in AD an exception is thrown instead of a warning message which causes confusion for the end user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Crowd, create a new directory to connect to a SimpleAD server in AWS with a complex password policy.
# Add the Crowd directory configured in previous step to JIRA Service Desk. And make that directory to the first directory in the list so that new users will be created in that directory.
# Set the password policy in JIRA to "Basic".
# During the new customer signup, enter a password which does not meet the password policy in Crowd.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA display a warning message to the customer informing the required password complexity requirement.

h3. Actual Results
An exception is thrown to the end user as below:
 !2016-09-19_password-err.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Exception thrown to customer when password does not meet the password policy defined in Crowd directory

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
With the release of Service Desk 3.2 workflow transitions can get performed by customers if this has been configured in the workflow as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-the-customer-portal-732528918.html#Configuringthecustomerportal-addTransitionsAddtransitions]. Non agent users can not perform these transitions from within JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow non agent users to perform workflow transitions that are available to customers from within the JIRA view issue screen.

h3. Workaround 
If a non agent user is added to the request as a participant, the user can perform the transition from the customer portal instead
fields.summary: Add customer transitions to the view issue screen for non agent users

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a user is being mentioned by an Agent in a Service Desk request in a public comment, the mentioned user will properly be displayed with its full name. As in JIRA though, the full name will be displayed as a link, where hovering over the link, the username can be obtained.

In particular in public facing environments it can be a security risk to be able to obtain a username of any users whatsoever.

h3. Suggested Solution
When any user is being mentioned, display the name in plain text in the customer portal, instead of a clickable link as it is in JIRA. Or provide the option to configure this as such.
fields.summary: Hide usernames on mentions in the customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4295].
  {panel}

Hi everyone,

We are using Zendesk at the time as a helpdesk tool, but would like to change for JIRA service desk as we are already heavilly using JIRA for management and love it.

Current service desk architecture is overly complex to me as it requires one instance to be created per project.  Managing 100+ clients, this sounds unusable and unmaintainable to me as we would need to make 100 modification everytime we would like to add a request type globally or change something as trivial as our logo.

Plus, this makes almost impossible to have a quick overview of SLA objectives and Queues status.

I would suggest having only one service desk in which we could add every customer specific SLA.  Customers would have to be linked to some kind of group so we could filter issues from every companies for reporting

Or maybe am I missing something?  Current implementation is a blocker for us as it does add considerable complexity and fails to get better reporting and better performance from our agents.

I really love JIRA and Butbucket and been using them for years and hope to see service desk development reach maturity soon.

Regards.
fields.summary: One service desk project, multiple client SLA's in it, queue filtering per customer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When there are emails from user with the same email address as another user but different application access, the request will be created but with some misleading errors in the Processing Log and different Reporter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Create a user with application access to JIRA Service Desk. This user will be an Agent.
# Create another user with the same email address as the user in step 1, but without any application access. This user will be a Customer.
# Send an email to JIRA Service Desk to create a request as the Agent.

h3. Expected Result
Either no request will be created with error about permission in the log, or request will be created successfully without any errors.

h3. Actual Result
Request is created but with problems below:
* Reporter is the Customer instead of the Agent
* In the Processing Log, the email is rejected with details {{You don't have permission to access this Service Desk}}.
fields.summary: Better handling of email request creation from users with same email address but different application access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In versions before 3.2.0, using *Run as the user who triggered the rule* for the Automation Rule to alert Agents will add an internal comment to the request.
After upgrading to 3.2.0, no internal comment will be added, hence the selected Agents in the Automation Rule are not notified.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Create an Automation Rule with settings below.
 {code}
 WHEN: Issue created
 IF: User is a customer
 THEN: Alert user <select an Agent>
 {code}
# Click on _Options_ to select *Run as the user who triggered the rule*.
# Create a request from Customer Portal *as a Customer*.

h3. Expected Behavior
An internal comment will be added in the request with the selected Agent mentioned in the comment.

h3. Actual Behavior
No internal comment is added, hence the selected Agent is not mentioned and notified.

h3. Workaround
Instead of using *Run as the user who triggered the rule*, use *Run as project default* instead.
(i) However, the internal comment will be added as the project default instead of the Reporter.
fields.summary: Automation Rule to alert Agents will not be triggered if the user is a Customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4283].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
In some cases an SD project may be linked with a Dev Tool e.g. Bitbucket and some SD tickets might have Commits related to them. In these cases, only those users who have both JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk application access are able to view the Development Panel in the SD tickets.

h4. +Suggestion+
A user with application access to JIRA Software should be able to view the Development Panel in SD tickets without application access to JIRA Service Desk. In other words, this permission should be added to the list of [what JIRA Software users can do in an SD project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER032/Setting+up+service+desk+users#Settingupservicedeskusers-limitedInvolvingJIRASoftwareandJIRACoreusers].

h4. +Notes+
(i) Permission Helper says a Software user without SD application access is not allowed to View Development Tools (which is correct by current design):
!YesSwNoSD.png|thumbnail!

(!) However, though it says an SD user without Software application access is allowed to View Development Tools, the user indeed cannot:
!NoSwYesSD.png|thumbnail!
, which means:
* the message is *incorrect*
* JIRA Software application access is a must

(/) Considering the above, Software access is more important than SD access to view development tools, so a Software user without SD application access should be able to view development tools.
fields.summary: Software users should be able to view Development Panel in Service Desk requests without Service Desk application access

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4282].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you set a Component lead as a non-agent JIRA user and create an issue from the customer portal choosing this component, the issue will be created and assigned to the Component Lead even though he is not an agent.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.335.0
* JIRA v1000.319.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Component in a Service Desk project and set the Component lead to a non-agent user.
# Set the *Default assignee* for the component to the component lead.
# Make sure that the non-agent user is in the *Service Desk Team* role which means they have *Assignable User* permission on the project.
# Create an issue through the customer portal choosing the component you just created in step 1.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is either unassigned or an error message is thrown as the user is not a Service Desk agent.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is created with the non-agent user as the *Assignee*.
fields.summary: In JIRA Service Desk, the default assignee can be set to a non agent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4277].
  {panel}

I'm glad to see that we can now enter date times as text on requests (since many users find the time portion of the picker confusing), but it needs to be more forgiving of trivial formatting differences. I really don't think a single, rigid format is sufficient.

Ideally these should all be handled the same, for example:
* 8/30/16 4:30 pm (this is the one that works in our setup)
* 8/30/16 4:30pm
* 8/30/16 4:30p
* 8/30/16 16:30
* 8/30/16 1630

Perhaps it could just reuse the existing date format, with an option for smarter time parsing?

The date portion is less critical I think (since the picker for this is intuitive), but it would still be nice if you could enter 8/30 and it would assume the current year.
fields.summary: Date Time entry needs to be more flexible

We've got multiple small projects, each having it's own list of customers. There are many groups of projects with same character, therefore they have got same request types configuration.

We would like to have ability to define request type scheme, and share it for multiple projects. Same as Issue Type Scheme, Screen Schemes,...

However, some projects are isolated. And, their PM would like to have an access to the request type configuration.

Therefore I suggest, that it would be possible to define request type scheme, which would work in two modes:
 * *project local request type scheme* - users with permission to administer project (project manager, project administrator) should be able to modify the request type scheme
 * *shared request type scheme* - only JIRA administrators have the ability to modify these request type scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4272].
{panel}
h3. Summary

When attempting to migrate from JIRA Server 7.2.X running JIRA Service Desk 3.2.X, the import process fails displaying an error that indicates JIRA Service Desk should first be upgraded before being imported into Cloud.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud - v1000.319.1
JIRA Service Desk - v3.3.0-OD-1000.335.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure your JIRA Server install is running JIRA 7.2.0 or later
 # Ensure you have installed JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0 or later from the Atlassian Marketplace
 # Run a full export of your JIRA Server install
 # Attempt to import this into JIRA Cloud

h3. Expected Results

The External System Import process should complete without error
h3. Actual Results

The External System Import process fails and displays the following error:
{noformat}
"We can't complete your upgrade. It looks like the data you are trying to import is from an earlier version of JIRA Service Desk. You need to upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 3.0 first, then export new data and try again. Read these upgrade notes for instructions: http://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/server_jira+jsd_upgrade"

{noformat}
h3. Notes

!importfailure.png|thumbnail!

Searching in the entities.xml file, you will see that the version of Service Desk running has not been completely upgraded:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.activeobjects.admin.ActiveObjectsPluginToTablesMapping : {"AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELDVALUE":{"key":"com.atlassian.servicedesk","name":"JIRA Service Desk","version":"2.3.6","vendorName":"Atlassian","vendorUrl":"http://www.atlassian.com"},"AO_54307E_QUEUECOLUMN":{"key":"com.atlassian.servicedesk","name":"JIRA Service Desk","version":"2.3.6","vendorName":"Atlassian","vendorUrl":"http://www.atlassian.com"}

{noformat}
This is caused by the customer most likely installed at some point the JIRA Service Desk plugin jar (even though it was not licensed) OR [Skipping major versions |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Skipping+major+versions+when+upgrading+JIRA+applicationsl]
h3. Workaround

The JIRA Server install must be downgraded in order to resolve this issue
 # Setup a temporary install of JIRA Server 7.1.9 and [connect to a new database |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+a+database]
 # Create an XML backup of JIRA 7.2 Server
 ** import this backup into the 7.1.9 Server.
 ** When running the import, JIRA will confirm that you want to downgrade your data
 # Once your JIRA 7.1.9 Server is running with your 7.2 data you can proceed to install JIRA Service Desk 3.0.0 [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions]]
 ** Make sure a license is added. You can generate an evaluation license by going to my.atlassian.com.
 ** To apply this license, you will want to go here: JIRA Administration > Applications > Versions & Licenses
 # Once the installation is complete and you have added the license, refresh the Versions & Licenses page
 ** Confirm that you see the Service Desk options on the left side. This will confirm that Service Desk loaded.
 # Create an XML backup of your JIRA 7.1.9 Server
 # Import this backup into your JIRA 7.2 instance
 # Create a backup of your JIRA 7.2 Server instance
 # Import this backup into your JIRA Cloud instance
fields.summary: Importing JIRA Service Desk Server site export into JIRA Cloud fails with version error

To have another tab for Microsoft Office365 which will restrict username format to prevent the [Office365 SMTP configuration receives authentication errors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/office365-smtp-configuration-receives-authentication-errors-646250764.html] problem to happen in the first place.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4269].
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#f9ffbf}
*Atlassian Support has not been able to reproduce this issue.* We need example emails so that we may try reproducing with the same exact message.

+We need the original base64 encoded email from the database.+ We can then load this base64 into a test instance to see if we can reproduce the "color value is invalid" problem.

Instructions for obtaining the base64 message can be found here: [How to Export The Email From JIRA Email Processor Plugin (JEPP) |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-export-the-email-from-jira-email-processor-plugin-jepp-777027033.html]
 * You can find an example issue with this problem in the UI then run the following SQL to get the mail item ID. The article has the directions for getting the base64 once you have the mail item ID.
 ** {{SELECT * FROM "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEMAUDIT" WHERE "ISSUE_KEY" = 'ABC-123';}}

*Do not attach examples to this public suggestion*
 * Please create a support case and attach the example to that support case.
  {panel}

Currently the HTML parser in JSD attempts to convert the content of a message to wiki markup. 

In most cases this works just fine. However, some mail clients (e.g. Airmail) add rgba-colors to each paragraph (which are just black though) and this results in very annoying lines in the body of the received content stating:

{quote}
color: Color value is invalid 
{quote}

This makes the message pretty unreadable. An example:

{quote}
color: Color value is invalid

Hello,
color: Color value is invalid
color: Color value is invalid

Can you guys please take a look at this and that?
color: Color value is invalid

If you need some help, just let me know!
color: Color value is invalid
color: Color value is invalid

Best regards,
Dennis
{quote}

These errors are outputted the same as the content: same size, same color so they are essentially part of the body. Why these errors have to be shown here, I don't know. In my opinion they do not add anything useful and makes working with JSD a lot more impractical.

Atlassian support recommended to change the renderer to "Default Text Renderer" but this results in seeing the raw wiki code instead, including all the color tags. 

If one provides an incorrect color (as there is no validation) in Confluence its simply shown in the default color (black). However, JSD outputs all errors in the body, where it shouldn't be.

Please hide these errors from the description.
fields.summary: Do not display non-functional errors of mail parsing in description

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Service Desk SLA configurations page has no limit to the number of goals that may exist. When a large number of goals are configured the SLA page takes long time to load and may eventually timeout or crash with an error
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Service Desk 2.5.8, 2.5.9, 3.2.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA Service Desk project .
 # Then , create 100++ goals for an SLA (number required depends on the machine) .
 # Refresh the page, the page will take long time to load. If enough goals are added the page will timeout.

h3. Expected Results

There's should be limitations to create Goals JQL query or JIRA Service Desk should load all the query in one minute (before it timeout) .
h3. Actual Results

The page allow to configure unlimited Goals JQL query . And the page is takes long time to load or does not load at all.
h3. Workaround
 # Reduce the number of goals configured
 # Increase resources on the JIRA server so that the goals are retrieved faster.
fields.summary: SLA Configuration page takes long time to load or times out

  {panel}

h3. Summary
As Described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30161 a service desk customer cannot view KB articles for a linked Confluence Space If Anonymous access is enabled for the space.  BUT the customers can partially View the content when browsing in the service desk customer portal.  Once the content is selected it fails to load, causing an overall confusing and negative customer experience as content displayed should be accessable.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Linked to KB
* Anonymously accessable Confluence Space

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Configure Service desk KB Link | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER032/Serving+customers+with+a+knowledge+base]
# Set the space linked to the portal as anonymously accessable
# Logged into the portal as a Service desk customer search for content 
# Select the link to the content populated in the search results *Solutions from knowledge base*

h3. Expected Results
*Either:*
- the Content is not populated by the search results as the current permissions for the customer will prevent them from viewing the content 

*OR:*
- the Content will load once selected

h3. Actual Results
Service Desk Customer selects link to suggested article displayed (Showing partial content) in the portal search results but is presented with an behavior described in {{https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30161}} and cannot access the content displayed from the portal through the oAuth link

h3.Workaround
# For a customer to view content without confusion, *disable anonymous access* to the space and set up the KB link as described here:
## https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/guide-to-link-knowledge-base-to-jira-service-desk-for-unlicensed-user-816677228.html
# The Service Desk Customer Must Log out to access the content anonymously
fields.summary: Unauthenticated Service Desk Customers can browse but not View Confluence Linked KB

h3. Problem Definition

When you have Service Desk integrated with a Confluence Knowledge base you can see search results for related articles from within JIRA. However these search results appear to be limited to only 3 results in this view. Conversely looking at the confluence space directly results many more search results.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4261].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
In certain cases, it may happen that:
# project SD1 has customers sd1cus1, sd1cus2
# project SD2 has customers sd2cusA, sd2cusB

(i) in other words, they have 2 totally different customer lists

In such a case like this, the 2 projects should be allowed to use the same email address for Email requests, in which:
* if sd1cus1 sends an email to this email address, JIRA detects that this customer belongs to SD1 only and will raise a request in SD1
* if sd2cusA sends an email to this email address, JIRA detects that this customer belongs to SD2 only and will raise a request in SD2

h4. +Suggestion+
When multiple SD projects meet the following requirements:
# each project has a distinct customer list in which no customer exists in more than one service desk
# public signup is not allowed and all projects have Request Security set to "Only people on my customers list"

they should be allowed to use the same email address for Email requests.
fields.summary: Allow multiple Service Desks with distinct customer lists to use the same Email Address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4260].
  {panel}

We are using JIRA, JIRA Servicedesk and Confluence, with Confluence also serving as a knowlegde base for our customers at the Servicedesk.

In Confluence it is possible to use JIRA links, powerful and useful! However, if one uses such a link in a Confluence space accessible to customers (who can only access the Servicedesk Portal) the JIRA links are dead to them. This is not well understood by our customers and does limit the combined power of Confluence and JIRA Servicedesk greatly. 

What would make the combination of JIRA Servicedesk and Confluence much more powerfull would be an extra authentication step with JIRA links in Confluence; 
* if a person has user-access to JIRA, wave through
* if a person has SD-customer-portal acces, send through to the customer portal view
* If a person has no JIRA access, show notification 'you are not authorised'

If this would become possible, we could use the JIRA-macro's in Confluence for a great many more purposes;
* Release notes
* Customer specific reports
* Interactive link in Questions (e.g. the following ticket has been created based on this discussion)
* ... etc. 

"Workaround" is to include the SD-portal link in Confluence, but this is a) no JIRA-link and b) not interactive
fields.summary: Confluence + JIRA Servicedesk > Linked JIRA issues are dead to Servicedesk Portal customers

Before JSD 3.2.0 when customer sends an email to the email channel configured in project A with a subject containing the issue key of project B, JIRA will add this email as a comment to the issue in project B.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4239].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As per the [JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html], it is currently not possible to upgrade directly from JIRA 6.4.x and Service Desk 2.5.9 to JIRA Core 7.2.x with JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x. Hence, customers running on JIRA 6.4.x will have to *upgrade twice, increasing their downtime* and also the upgrade effort to go to JIRA 7.2.x and JSD 3.2.x.
h3. Suggested Solution

As a JIRA administrator, I would like to be able to upgrade from JIRA 6.4.x and JSD 2.5.9 to JIRA 7.2 and JIRA Service Desk 3.2 directly so that I can perform a single upgrade.

h3. Workaround

The following [jira-config.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Advanced+JIRA+application+configuration#AdvancedJIRAapplicationconfiguration-jira-config.propertiesThejira-config.propertiesfile] parameters can be used when upgrading from JIRA 6.4 to 7.0 and Service Desk 3.0:
{code}
upgrade.reindex.allowed=false
jira.autoexport=false
{code}

This will cause the intermediate upgrade path ( JIRA 6.4 -> JIRA 7.0 -> JIRA 7.2 ) to occur much faster as JIRA performs an export and re-index normally as part of the upgrade which takes a long time in larger environments and is unnecessary for intermediate upgrade versions. These parameters can be removed when upgrading JIRA 7 to JIRA 7.2
fields.summary: As a JIRA Service Desk administrator, I would like to be able to upgrade from JSD 2.5.9 to 3.2 directly

fields.description:
h2. Description of problem:

A NullPointerException is thrown due to a missing ICON_ID in "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM".
 * JIRA Service Desk will not fully start if one of the affected request types is configured to receive email. This results in partial functionality working.
 * When JIRA Service Desk does start, users are unable to access some request types or service desk projects. In some cases the entire customer portal may not load.

Request types that are missing the ICON_ID are affected and portals containing those request types may experience problems. In addition, when configuring request types the "Edit Fields" link on affected request types no longer works.
 * The "Edit Fields" link does work for unaffected request types in the same service desk project.
 * The service desk project containing affected request type(s) will not load in customer portal. Users may see an error, a spinning icon, or a blank page.

h2. Steps to reproduce:

It is unknown how this the data got into this state, the problem occurred on a customer's instance after starting JIRA Service Desk.
 * It is possible to trigger this problem and see the symptoms by setting the ICON_ID of a request type to be NULL.
 * In one case Service Desk logs of upgrade from version 2.5.9 > 3.1.9 > 3.2.1 do not show where "SyncUpgradeTaskMigrateRequestTypeIconIDs" ever ran.
 _NB: This task may have run previously in 3.1.x as AsyncUpgradeTaskMigrateRequestTypeIconIDs_

h2. Expected Results

JSD starts without any problems and after startup there are no issues accessing request types or portal.
h2. Actual Results
h6. Startup Problem

The below exception is thrown during startup when an affected request type is configured for email:
{noformat}2016-08-30 03:43:19,490 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR      [c.a.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle] 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at scala.Predef$.Long2long(Predef.scala:358)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.requesttype.RequestType$.apply(RequestType.scala:73)

h2. Diagnosis:

A list of affected portals can be obtained by running:
{noformat}SELECT v."NAME", f."VIEWPORT_ID" FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" AS v 
	JOIN "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" AS f 
	ON v."ID"=f."VIEWPORT_ID" 
	WHERE f."ICON_ID" IS NULL 
	GROUP BY f."VIEWPORT_ID", v."NAME"
	ORDER BY v."NAME";

{noformat}
A list of affected request types can be obtained by running:
{noformat}SELECT v."NAME", f."NAME", f."VIEWPORT_ID", f."ICON", f."ICON_ID" FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" AS v 
	INNER JOIN "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" AS f 
	ON v."ID"=f."VIEWPORT_ID" 
	WHERE f."ICON_ID" IS NULL 
	GROUP BY f."VIEWPORT_ID", f."NAME", v."NAME",f."ICON",f."ICON_ID"
	ORDER BY v."NAME";

{noformat}
h2. Workaround:
h6. If JIRA Service Desk is accessible

Use the SQL query to retrieve a list of affected request types. Manually change the icon for each of these request types in the Service Desk user interface.
h6. If JIRA Service Desk failed to load

This was fixed by identifying there was a missing icon for the JIRA Service Desk customer portal. the broken icon was identified with the below SQL:
{code:java}select "ICON_ID", a.* from "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" vpf left outer join avatar a on a.id = vpf."ICON_ID" where a.id is null;

{code}
And then fixed by updating the database to point the icon to an existing icon (ie a record in the {{avatar}} table that exists), and then JSD was restarted and the Customer Portal updated.
h2. Background:

In Service Desk Server version 3.1.9, icons attached to request types are recorded in the ICON column in "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM".

As of 3.2.1 the icons are stored in the ICON_ID column, also in the "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" table.

An upgrade task performs this change
{noformat}    *********************************************************************************
    JIRA ServiceDesk v3.2.0-051 #DevVersion built 2016-08-26T20:02:10.216-05:00 - Starting sync upgrade task: SyncUpgradeTaskMigrateRequestTypeIconIDs
    *********************************************************************************

{noformat}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4226].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today, a customer can only access to a request which he/she is a reporter, or a participant. There's no way to allow some customers to view other/all requests, or to make some requests viewable by all customers

h3. Suggested Solution
To make the visibility of requests configurable via Issue Security
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to configure the visibility of a request via project Issue Security

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Emails with content-type other than *Multipart* will be created as a new request, however if the email contains an attachment it will not be added to the request

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Send an email to Service Desk project with content-type below. For example, the voicemail notification through email from Cisco Unity Connection
 {code}
 Content-Type: audio/wav; name=VoiceMessage.wav
 Content-Transfer-Encoding: Base64
 Content-Disposition: inline; filename=VoiceMessage.wav; voice=Voice-Message
 {code}
# The request will be created without the .wav file attached.

h3. Cause
The mail handler has not been designed to handle non-multipart email properly.

h3. Workaround
Try forwarding the email, a request will be created with the .wav file added as an attachment in the comment.
(i) The forwarded email will have {{Content-Type: multipart/mixed}} or {{Content-Type: multipart/alternative}} in the email header
fields.summary: Attachment in non-multipart email will not be attached to the request created

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4224].
  {panel}

I wanted to add approvals to my IT helpdesk workflow, so I made a copy of that workflow and tried to add approvals to it.
 It did not work because the approvals button was not shown:

!image-2016-08-30-18-17-30-882.png|width=657,height=323!

However, when I edit the active workflow directly from the service desk project, it is there.

!image-2016-08-30-18-18-11-877.png|width=654,height=325!

This is a bit of an inconvenience because I cannot make all the changes I want to an inactive workflow and then set it active.

I understand why it is not shown - because in its inactive state there probably is no connection to service desk for that workflow. Would be nice if you could make this possible nonetheless.
fields.summary: Approvals option should be shown even if workflow not edited from service desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4223].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in Service Desk upon one approver declines an issue the issue is considered declined and the decline transition triggers

h3. Suggested Solution

Have an option to only consider an issue declined when a set number of approvers have declined or to have JIRA calculate the number with the formulas : number of required decline vote = number of approvers - number of required approval vote + 1
fields.summary: Consider declined only when several approvers have declined

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4222].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
In some cases, there's a need to send attachment links to anonymous users/customers (without an account) for download. However, JIRA Service Desk will require a login before the attachments can be downloaded.

h4. +Suggestion+
It would be convenient to allow anonymous access to attachments, in a way that everyone can download as long as they have links.
fields.summary: Allow anonymous users/customers to download attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA becomes inacessible after upgrading JIRA Service Desk to 3.2.0.

h3. Environment
* PostgreSQL 9.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.0.10 or 7.1.9
# Install JIRA Service Desk 3.0.10 or 3.1.9
# Upgrade JIRA to 7.2.0
# Navigate to *Cog Icon > Applications > Upgrade JIRA Service Desk to 3.2.0*
# Navigate to any other page in JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should be accessible after the upgrade.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA becomes inacessible, showing a 500 error with the following stack trace:
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-29 at 1.26.24 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* It doesn't look like anything breaks permanently. JIRA works fine after a restart.
* Uninstalling JSD 3.0.10 on JIRA 7.2.0 before installing JSD 3.2.0 does not make a difference.

I have included the full {{catalina.out}} from the moment JSD begun its update and the full stack trace above in the following attachments:
*  [^catalina.out from the moment JSD started being updated.txt] 
*  [^full stack trace.txt] 

h3. Workarounds
* Restart JIRA. No errors occur after that.
* When upgrading JIRA to 7.2.0, use a clean {{jira-home}} folder, without any add-ons.
fields.summary: JIRA becomes inacessible after upgrading JIRA Service Desk to 3.2.0.

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA Service Desk when agent creates an KB article from an issue the new KB will be created in the same space which Service Desk project connects to and the page will be published therefore accessible immediately par the customer. However in some cases, the user wants the the new KB to be created in a private space in order to be validated before it can go public.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA Service Desk to link to a separate Confluence space for KB creation.

h3. Summary

Upgrading Service desk to 3.2 from a version <= 2.5.x breaks project navigation sidebar
h3. Environment

When attempting to upgrade a Service Desk instance from a version <= 2.5.x directly to 3.2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create XML backup from existing JIRA 6.4.x instance running Service Desk 2.5.x
 # Install a fresh instance of Service Desk 3.2.0
 # Use the 'import existing data' link to restore this XML backup
 # Navigate to a Service Desk Project, and look at the side bar for project navigation

h3. Notes

While service desk does appear to start up, the sidebar navigation appear to be corrupted for all existing Service Desk projects and new Service Desk projects. The top of the navigation menu has the error "Unable to render element due to an error"

!jsd32unabletorender.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

 # [Rollback|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/rolling-back-a-jira-application-upgrade-802592268.html] the JIRA upgrade first
 # Then upgrade to a Service Desk version such as 3.0.10 (Corresponds to JIRA Server 7.0.10)
 # Once this upgrade is complete, you should then be able to upgrade JIRA to 7.2 and Service Desk to 3.2

*Option 2*
 Follow the directions in the "resolution 1" section of [After upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0 Service Desk project navigation bar shows unable to render element due to an error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/after-upgrading-to-jira-service-desk-3-2-0-service-desk-project-s-navigation-bar-shows-unable-to-render-element-due-to-an-error-845943102.html]

{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

As soon as a user is added to an issue as an approver, that user is treated as a customer for the purposes of notifications, even if they're an agent. Unless they then remove themselves after approving a given issue, they'll miss out on receiving any subsequent internal notifications.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue that has an approval process.
 # Add a user that is an Agent as an approver.
 # Get the issue to the approval step.

h3. Expected Results

The user receives the approval notifications, and also the agent notifications.
h3. Actual Results

The user is being considered a customer and only receives customer notifications.
h3. Workarounds
* Enable Service Desk to send both Jira and Customer notifications when the user is an agent. This can be done by going to Jira Administration > Applications, option Configuration, scroll down and change the _Notification_ setting to "Yes, send customers both Jira Service Desk and Jira Notifications" !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
* Have the approvers remove themselves from the Approvers list.

Original description:
{quote}As soon as a user is added to an issue as an approver, that user is treated as a customer for the purposes of notifications, even if they're an agent. Unless they then remove themselves after approving a given issue, they'll miss out on receiving any subsequent internal notifications.

The use case here is when a customer is set as an approver and merely replies via email saying "This is approved" but doesn't visit the portal to actually click the Approve button. The agent can add herself to the Approvers field and manually approve it to transition the issue through the workflow.
{quote}
fields.summary: Approvers should not be always treated as customers

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When granting Project Permission to a Single User, the suggested users list includes Customers. If we proceed with granting the permission to the customer, it will be successful but in fact a customer can never use the granted permission. 
* This is very confusing as it appears that an admin can grant a project permission to a customer but it doesn't work actually.

h3. Suggestions
* Do not suggest Customers in the user picker field in the Project Permission page.
* Label a customer as Customers in the suggested users list.
* Display a warning when an admin is granting permission to a customer.
fields.summary: As an admin, I am confused when a customer appears in the user suggestion list when I'm granting Project Permissions to Single User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4205].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Due to the fact that the IF clause in the Service Desk automation rules has a "Comment contains" option, it would be beneficial to be able to change the value of a field based on the comment contents
Changing field values through the THEN clause currently is not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
The option to change field values in the THEN clause should not be exclusive to the "Comment contains" IF option, the below just serves as an example.
If the automation rule contains a certain string, say "priority=x", the THEN clause should have to option change the value of the priority field.
This would allow for customers to set the priority of their requests through comments or email, which currently is not possible.
A feature request exists [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1393] which has been indicated to not getting implemented, though the method in that request is limited to the priority field, whereas this feature request could cover other (custom) fields as well.
fields.summary: Allow automation rules to change field values

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4204].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Due to the fact that the IF clause in the Service Desk automation rules has a "Comment contains" option, it would be beneficial to be able to assign issues to a particular Agent.
Request assignment in the THEN clause currently is not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
The option to assign issues to a user in the THEN clause should not be exclusive to the "Comment contains" IF option, the below just serves as an example.
If the automation rule contains a certain string, say "assign to agent x", the THEN clause should have to option "assign to user" and pick a user from a dropdown menu
fields.summary: Add assign to a user as Automation option

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4202].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

Sometimes customer request are directly sent to the agent's email. Some company has auto forwarding configurations to automatically divert all customer mails from agent's email to Service Desk mail handler.

Zendesk has a feature known as 'Sent Through' that allows you to detect the where the mail is being forwarded from. With this feature, the customer request can be assigned to the specific agent the email is sent to before being forwarded.

It's a good feature to have.
fields.summary: 'Sent Through' feature for JIRA Service Desk

h3. Problem 
The fields in the SLAs panel are not translated to other languages when the application default language is set to other languages such as French, German and etc.
The fields are also not translatable using the InProduct Translation plugin.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA as an admin.
# Go to {{JIRA Administration > System > General configuration}}, change the *Default Language* to any other language, for example Spanish.
# Open an existing issue which SLAs panel is present.
# Check on the fields in the SLAs panel.

h3. Expected Result
The field name in the SLAs panel are as the default language.

h3. Actual Result
The field name (Time to resolution) in the SLAs panel are still display in English.
 !field.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Fields in the SLAs panel are not translated and not translatable

h3. Summary
When you create an issue using Service Desk customer portal, then you add a link to another issue using "[issue key]" pattern, thumbnail is missing as shown in attachment. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Service Desk with customer portal enabled 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service desk project and enable costumer portal. (use [wiki style renderer] for description and comments).
# Create an issue type with customized icon/update an existing issue type with customized icon
# Create an issue with the issue type created above
# Go to customer portal and create an issue, in description insert an issue key into "[]" for displaying as a link and show thumbnail.
# The thumbnail will show a browser missing image icon (attached image).

h3. Expected Results
Show the thumbnail with a preview from the referenced issue.

h3. Actual Results
The thumbnail appear as a missing image icon.

h3. Notes
tried to give "browse projects" permission on the project from which you're referencing an issue from, to "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" entity, even though the logged user already had this permission.

h3.Workaround
Found no suitable workaround.
fields.summary: When inserting a issue link in description or comment and viewing from Customer Portal, thumbnail is missing

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when users set automation rules and they fail to execute in an event. Then there is no quick way to verify if the parameters have any issues. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be easier if we have an automation helper, where users could specify values for the variables and test if the rule would execute, just like the permission and notification helper in JIRA.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to have an Automation Rules Helper to verify if the rule would execute if certain parameters are given

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4195].
  {panel}

Quite often the agent has more than a just a few attachments on the issue. 

As it is right now she needs to publish the attachment thru adding a comment. Fair and square and probably a safety net to prevent all attachments to be published out. 

However, when having a lot of attachments on the issue, the process of finding out which attachment is public and which is not, is a tad tedious. Either crosschecking portal view vs issue view or crosschecking attachments on issue with comments. 

Can we get som sort of symbol to mark up which attachment is visible to the customer?

br
Lisa
fields.summary: Visualize which attachments are published on the customer portal

The behavior is the same if you try to change the type of an existing project to Service Desk.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.2.0;
# Upload JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0 through *Administration > Applications > Versions & licenses*;
# Try to create a new Service Desk project;

h3. Workaround
This issue was caused by a missing schema definition {{<schema-name>}} in the {{dbconfig.xml}} file, possibly due to JRA-47663.
There are three possible ways to prevent or manually correct this problem.

# Run the {{config.sh}} utility in visual mode and ensure the schema is set;
# Use JIRA's Setup Wizard - shown upon first startup in the browser;
# Manually specify {{<schema-name>name_of_schema</schema-name>}} just above the {{<jdbc-datasource>}} section on JIRA's {{dbconfig.xml}} file - located under {{<[JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]>/}};

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4191].
  {panel}

Dear Support,
I was wondering if you can share information about the availability to setting up approvals for Jira Service Desk, hosted on a server. While the cloud version already has the functionality to set up approvals. I'm referring to [Jira Cloud setting up approval|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-service-desk-approvals-815569154.html].

What I would like to know, can you share your expectation when this function will be available?
Do you also know what will be the version of the Service Desk with the functionality for setting up approvals? We are now on JIRA Service Desk 3.1.9.

Thanks in advance,

Best Regards,
Wim van Oorspronk
fields.summary: Setting up approvals for Jira Service Desk Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Service Desk Email requests configuration page loads indefinitely after importing backup from Cloud to Server.
h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk migrated from Cloud to Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get a Cloud backup
 # Restore into JIRA Service Desk 3.1.9
 # Go to {{Project Administration >> Email requests}}

h3. Expected Results

Email requests configuration page loads
h3. Actual Results

Email requests configuration page loads indefinitely and the below exception is thrown in the _atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log_ file:
{noformat}

Additionally this will cause JIRA Service Desk functionality not to load, and can cause the "Snap! You can't view this page" error to appear.
h3. Workaround

There are 2 workarounds:

Remove all Email requests before generating the backup in Cloud

OR
 
 Remove the {{CONNECTIONFAILUREHANDLER}} from database after restoring the backup into JIRA Service Desk Server

This can be done with the following:
# Stop JIRA.
# Backup the database.
# Execute the below SQL:
{code:SQL}
delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILHANDLER" where "HANDLER_TYPE" = 'CONNECTIONFAILUREHANDLER';

fields.summary: Dashboard doesn't load when SD is being restarted

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4188].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Add an additional tag option "Progress Notes" to indicate that the comment entry is a progress update. This allows users to build a report and extract just the Progress notes entries.

h3. Suggested Solution
Configure Jira Service desk to be able to add additional tagging to the customer comments field in addition to "Share with Customer" and "Comment internally," as below:
 !additional_tag.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add additional tagging to the customer comments field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Inconsistent JIRA Service Desk REST API Pagination
